intro: Hypocalyptus obcordatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hypocalyptus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Proteaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, obcordate (heart-shaped at the base) leaves and is native to southern Africa. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in inflorescences that are either racemose or corymbose. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
